#summary Prepare IDE Eclipse to develop Web Application
#labels Open-Ones,Eclipse,Plugins

= Introduction =

This text helps you prepare an IDE Eclipse to develop Web Application, Google App and Android


= Details =
== 1. Download and install JDK 1.6 ==
== 2. Download customized Eclipse JEE ==
=== 2.1 For Window ===

1) Download eclipse-jee-indigo-SR1-win32-OOG-0.1.zip.001 at FShare: http://www.fshare.vn/file/M2VJY4UWOO

or at Mediafire: http://mediafire.com/?3euzew8c9i0xxc7

2) Download eclipse-jee-indigo-SR1-win32-OOG-0.1.zip.002 at FShare: http://www.fshare.vn/file/IWJEA3Y0QW or Mediafire http://mediafire.com/?1ggyf6tu3yhecw2

Use [http://7zip.org 7zip ] to combine and un-compress three above files (Assumption: you un-compress into D:/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-win32-OpenOnes-0.8. This folder is called $ECLIPSE_HOME)

You can try to run the eclipse by execute $ECLIPSE_HOME/eclipse/eclipse.exe.

=== 2.1 For Linux (I'm using Fedora 15 + KDE) ===

1) http://www.mediafire.com/file/93869lrx86o0fgx/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gzaa


2) http://www.mediafire.com/file/uv5lgqkq4rza7we/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gzab


3) http://www.mediafire.com/file/la1qw0f66c6wcff/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gzac

4) http://www.mediafire.com/file/4ektwvvv5eo3din/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gzad

5) http://www.mediafire.com/file/kgxrncee0hw9pcn/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gzae

Join these files by command:

|| cat eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gz`*` > eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gz ||

Uncompress file eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gz the by command:

|| tar -zxvf eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8.tar.gz --directory ~/jPackages ||

~: Home directory of current user
If folder ~/jPackages has not existed, create it by command

|| mkdir ~/jPackages ||

You should create a shortcut in the Desktop by copy file /home/thachln/jPackage/eclipse-jee-helios-SR2-linux-gtk-open-ones-0.8/Eclipse.desktop into your Desktop (for KDE, it is folder ~/Desktop)

Setting the "Command" and "Work path" to match with your folder by right click on shortcut "Eclipse" in the Desktop, select Properties, choose tab Application.

Default, the eclipse uses JRE. Now, you re-configure the eclipse to use JDK.
